description: Skeletons on Valentine's Day humorously face a dilemma; they have nobody to love.
title: Lonely Bones
n_1: In a moonlit graveyard, Skully seems gloomy, looking at couples outside.
c1_1: Ah, to be young and corporeal.
n_2: Bonnie tries to cheer Skully up, showing a humorous side.
c1_2: Just missing the heart I don't have.
c2_2: We've got each other! Who needs a heartbeat?
n_3: Skully smiles for the first time tonight, considering Bonnie's words.
c1_3: You're right, who needs a Valentine when I've got a bone-friend like you?
c2_3: Exactly! Let's dance to the bone-rattling beats!
n_4: Under the starry sky, they dance, forgetting the need for anyone else.
c1_4: Who knew skeletons could have so much fun?
c2_4: As long as we're together, every day is Valentine's Day!
